Publications and Research Projects

Deep Neural Network Model for Automated Detection of Alzheimer’s Disease using EEG Signals

DOI Link

This study proposes an automated and highly accurate approach for detecting Alzheimer’s Disease using EEG signals, combining signal processing techniques with deep learning methods. The methodology incorporates Butterworth filters, discrete wavelet transform (DWT), statistical feature extraction, data augmentation, generative adversarial networks (GANs), and convolutional neural networks (CNNs). This integrated approach yielded a classifier with a peak accuracy of 97.61%. The study was conducted using MATLAB and Python.

Hand Tracking using Object Detection

Worked with YoloV3 object detection framework for tracking hand movement using bounding boxes. This work involved developing a new dataset from scratch and using annotation tools to define bounding boxes. A dataset with frame-wise images and 21 features was created and used for training the framework.
